docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Tom Fitton, president of Judicial Watch, describes organization's past attempts to call attention to potential conflicts of interests involving American presidents; assesses Pres-elect Donald Trump's conflicts of interests, and suggests steps to be taken that are fair to both Trump Organization and American public, including creation of internal watchdog to help develop procedures that could facilitate full transparency and help avoid conflicts.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president-elect’s three eldest children have always interwoven family and business ties. Can their empire ever be separate from the White House?
docs.abstract: Donald Trump's children, tasked with running his business empire while he is president, face tangle of conflicting interests exacerbated by fact siblings have spent their lives combining family and business; examination of professional histories of Ivanka, Eric and Donald Trump Jr shows how deeply Trump family, Trump business and Trump politics are interwoven, raising significant doubts about Donald Trump's ability to separate business from presidency.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER, RACHEL ABRAMS, BARRY MEIER and HIROKO TABUCHI
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Susanne Craig, Michael Barbaro, Maggie Haberman, Steve Eder, Richard C. Paddock and Chris Dixon. Kitty Bennett, Doris Burke and Jeremy B. Merrill contributed research.

docs.lead_paragraph: AFTER seven lean years of finding too little of merit being built along Manhattan's most fashionable avenues to warrant its awards for architectural excellence, the Fifth Avenue Association is presenting five awards this year. Among the winners are the atrium of Trump Tower and recent additions to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Explaining the resumption of the awards, Michael B. Grosso, executive vice president of the association, said ''the members now feel a lot of quality building is going on, and they want to recognize it and encourage more.'' Awards now will be made biennially, he said. Members are property owners, businessmen and leaders of institutions along Fifth, Madison and Park Avenues, Park Avenue South and 57th Street.

headline.main: FIFTH AVENUE ASSN. RESUMES ARCHITECTURE AWARDS
